coreNumbers.dataPoint: Tech debt = 20-40% of technology estate value (before depreciation)
coreNumbers.implication: This is a board-level financial liability, not an engineering preference.

coreNumbers.dataPoint: US cost of poor software quality: $2.41T annually; $1.52T to remediate
coreNumbers.implication: The aggregate cost exceeds the GDP of most countries.

coreNumbers.dataPoint: 33-42% of developer time spent on debt, maintenance, legacy code
coreNumbers.implication: Every dollar of engineering salary, 33-42 cents goes to fighting the past instead of building the future.

coreNumbers.dataPoint: 10-20% of 'new feature' budget is covertly diverted to debt work
coreNumbers.implication: Feature budgets are already subsidizing debt silently. Making it explicit gives leadership honest data.

coreNumbers.dataPoint: >50% of IT budget on legacy integration = 'technical bankruptcy'
coreNumbers.implication: At this point, delivering new value is nearly impossible without greenfield rewrite.

coreNumbers.dataPoint: Paying down debt frees up to 50% more time for value-generating work
coreNumbers.implication: The ROI of debt remediation is not abstract — it's measured in developer-hours returned to feature work.

investmentMandate.description: Protect 15-20% of engineering capacity for debt remediation, platform health, and modernization. This is non-negotiable.
strategies: Reframe the language: never say 'refactoring' or 'tech debt.' Say 'reliability investment,' 'productivity enablement,' or 'delivery acceleration.'
Quantify the interest payments: calculate 'We spend X eng-hours/week working around [specific legacy system]. At $Y/hr fully-loaded, that's $Z/year in interest payments on technical debt.'

Show the Lead Time connection: 'Lead Time for Team Alpha is 5 days. 3.2 days of that is caused by [legacy CI pipeline / monolith coupling / manual QA gate]. Investing 8 eng-weeks in [specific fix] would reduce Lead Time to <1 day.'

Model the Investment Mix: present the current split and the target — 'We're currently at 72% features / 8% reliability / 12% debt / 8% security. Industry benchmark for sustainable velocity is 55-65% features / 15-20% reliability+debt. We need to shift 7 points to platform work.'

cd3.formula: CD3 = Weekly Financial Value / Weeks to Deliver
cd3.description: Sequence work by highest CD3, not highest total value. Prioritizing by highest total value locks up capacity for long durations before delivering any value.
cd3.whenToUse: Major initiatives (>1 quarter of team effort). Not for sprint-level ticket prioritization.
cd3.impact: In enterprise portfolios, CD3 sequencing reduces aggregate delay costs 20-60%.
